stance_1: I believe meat is my natural diet
justification: The interviewee explicitly links growing up eating meat to believing it is their natural diet.

stance_1: I believe meat is my natural diet
stance_2: I feel a healthy meal includes meat
justification: Belief in meat as a natural diet supports the view that a healthy meal includes meat.

stance_1: I believe meat is my natural diet
stance_2: Meat is a good source of protein
justification: The naturalness of eating meat is supported by the belief that it is a good source of protein.

stance_2: I love the taste of meat
justification: Regular chicken consumption is supported by enjoyment of meat taste.

stance_2: I love the taste of meat
justification: Occasional pork eating is supported by a general love for meat taste.

stance_2: I love the taste of meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects loving the taste of red meat to eating it regularly.

stance_1: I feel a healthy meal includes meat
stance_2: Meat is a good source of protein
justification: The interviewee states a healthy meal includes protein, which is provided by meat.
The interviewee explicitly links their upbringing to their family's shared meat-eating habits.

stance_1: I love the taste of meat
justification: A family culture of meat eating likely supports enjoyment of meat taste.

stance_1: I love the taste of meat
justification: The love for meat taste contrasts with some family members' veganism, though not strongly conflicted as there is respect for dietary choices.

stance_1: Meat is a good source of protein
justification: Belief in the nutritional value of meat supports the family's meat-eating habits.
It is explicitly stated that while most of the family eats meat, some are vegan, showing a clear dietary divide.

stance_1: Social contacts are motivated by animal welfare
justification: The interviewee gives animal welfare as the explicit motivation for veganism in some family members.
